meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I kept my promise to help my friend.
meanings.sent2: She kept her room tidy by putting away her toys.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept forgetting where it buried its acorns!
meanings.sent4: His words of wisdom kept ringing in my ears long after he left.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse keeper kept watch over the stormy sea, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: maintained in a particular state or condition
meanings.sent1: The well-kept garden was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: She always wore a neat and well-kept uniform to school.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur was so well-kept, it looked like silk.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a well-kept secret hidden in its walls.
meanings.sent5: The well-kept secret finally came to light, surprising everyone.

meanings.sent1: He kept his childhood toy as a cherished memory.
meanings.sent2: She kept the key to the treasure chest hidden in her pocket.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept pulling rabbits out of his hat, to everyone's amazement.
meanings.sent4: The old man kept a watchful eye on the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent5: The explorer kept a journal of his adventures, documenting every detail.
